result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon R. Yager was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1-13CF497 & Count #1-14CF135, the Court sentences Mr. Yager to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months, each count. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being and concurrent to each other, forthwith

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement
wth elements

Cases 13CF497, 13CM573 & 14CF135 called together at 9:12 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Shannon R. Yager in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-13CF497 & Count #1-14CF135; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #
2-13CF497, Count #1-13CM573

On Count #1-13CF497 & Count #1-14CF135, the Court sentences Mr. Yager to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months, each count. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being and concurrent to each other, forthwith

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 113 days credit for time already served-14CF135
The Court gives 153 days credit for time already served-13CF497

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with all recommended treatment, per Agent
--Absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Random drug and alcohol screens
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--To pay $50 drug testing fee (13CF497)
--To pay $50 drug testing fee (14CF135)
--To pay $500 DNA Surcharge ($250 each case)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay costs of $
536 ($268 each count)
--To reimburse $66 subpoena fees (13CF497)
--To reimburse $40 buy money (14CF135)
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise as deemed appropriate per Agent

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Court denies expungement in each case
Recess: 9:36 am
Status conference on August 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #13CF497, #13CM573, and #14CF135 called at 9:42am. 
Defendant Shannon R. Yager in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appear for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates they have received a global offer from the State, however there is no resolution yet.  Even though a settlement is still possible, Attorney De La Rosa proposes that the cases be set for trial. 
recess 9:44am 

NEXT:  (1) schedule cases #13CM573 and #13CF497 for FSSC and Jury Trials, setting case #13CM573 first in time  (2) schedule #14CF135 for Status Conferences, tracking the FSSC dates/times in the other two cases
Status conference on July 1, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 25, 2014 at 10:20 am.
MK

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF135, #13CF497, #13CM573 called at 8:44am. 
Defendant Shannon R. Yager in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (for Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa).  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In Case #14CF135, Mr. Yager waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
In Case #14CF135 Arraignment is conducted:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered

The Court and counsel discuss scheduling;  ADA Hall indicates that the State has made a global plea offer. 
recess 8:46am. 
 
NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/25/14 at 10:20  (2) schedule all three cases for Status Conference shortly after the Pretrial date
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 21, 2014 at 09:40 am.

case called at 8:38am. (along with cases #13CF497, #13CM573--separate minutes for each case)
Defendant Shannon R. Yager in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1000 cash bond, with conditions: 
--no direct or indirect contact with Lynn Miller
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 8:43am. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/21/14 at 9:40am  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing approximately 2-3 weeks after Pretrial date
